main_definition: Anyone at all, regardless of who they are.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to refer to any person in general without specifying identity. Example: 'Is there anybody here that can help me?'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Can anyone lend me a hand with this project?'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Asking if there is at least one person available or willing to do something. Example: 'Anybody up for going out tonight?'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Is anybody free to come along to the party?'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to express that no particular person stands out as being responsible, capable, or involved in a situation. Example: 'It's not anybody's fault; it was an accident.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'The broken window wasn't caused by anyone specific.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Indicating that the subject is open to anyone who wants or can participate. Example: 'This job isn't for anybody with a fear of heights.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'The marathon run is available for anybody who decides to join.'
